verbs.description: attorney general jeff sessions attacks [ARG0: judges] [V: thwarting] [ARG1: trump agenda] hits order for wilbur ross deposition as the supreme court considered whether commerce secretary wilbur ross must answer questions in a court case about why he decided to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census attorney general jeff sessions on monday publicly attacked the judge who ordered ross to be deposed calling his actions outrageous even though they 've been upheld by three appellate judges sessions prepared remarks to the conservative heritage foundation monday came in the context of a larger complaint about numerous court decisions that have blocked trump administration actions particularly its attempted crackdown on illegal immigration dreamers and its ban on transgender people serving in the military white house attorney united states department of justice executive washington supreme court jesse m furman environmental protection agency jesse m furman justice acting assistant attorney general steve bannon new york jeff sessions john gore commerce secretary wilbur ross sessions donald trump secretary of commerce wilbur ross president haiti el salvador united states courts of appeals executive branch justice department district of columbia supreme court of canada conservative heritage foundation u s court of appeals tara bahrampour civil rights division secretary

[ARG0: attorney general jeff sessions] attacks judges thwarting trump agenda [V: hits] [ARG1: order for wilbur ross deposition] [ARGM-TMP: as the supreme court considered whether commerce secretary wilbur ross must answer questions in a court case about why he decided to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census attorney general jeff sessions on monday publicly attacked the judge who ordered ross to be deposed calling his actions outrageous even though they 've been upheld by three appellate judges sessions prepared remarks to the conservative heritage foundation monday came in the context of a larger complaint about numerous court decisions that have blocked trump administration actions particularly its attempted crackdown on illegal immigration dreamers and its ban on transgender people serving in the military white house attorney united states department of justice executive washington supreme court jesse m furman environmental protection agency jesse m furman justice acting assistant attorney general steve bannon new york jeff sessions john gore commerce secretary wilbur ross sessions donald trump secretary of commerce wilbur ross president haiti el salvador united states courts of appeals executive branch justice department district of columbia supreme court of canada conservative heritage foundation u s court of appeals tara bahrampour civil rights division secretary]

attorney general jeff sessions attacks judges thwarting trump agenda hits order for [ARG0: wilbur] [V: ross] deposition as the supreme court considered whether commerce secretary wilbur ross must answer questions in a court case about why he decided to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census attorney general jeff sessions on monday publicly attacked the judge who ordered ross to be deposed calling his actions outrageous even though they 've been upheld by three appellate judges sessions prepared remarks to the conservative heritage foundation monday came in the context of a larger complaint about numerous court decisions that have blocked trump administration actions particularly its attempted crackdown on illegal immigration dreamers and its ban on transgender people serving in the military white house attorney united states department of justice executive washington supreme court jesse m furman environmental protection agency jesse m furman justice acting assistant attorney general steve bannon new york jeff sessions john gore commerce secretary wilbur ross sessions donald trump secretary of commerce wilbur ross president haiti el salvador united states courts of appeals executive branch justice department district of columbia supreme court of canada conservative heritage foundation u s court of appeals tara bahrampour civil rights division secretary

attorney general jeff sessions attacks judges thwarting trump agenda hits order for wilbur ross deposition as [ARG0: the supreme court] [V: considered] [ARG1: whether commerce secretary wilbur ross must answer questions in a court case about why he decided to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census attorney general jeff sessions on monday publicly attacked] the judge who ordered ross to be deposed calling his actions outrageous even though they 've been upheld by three appellate judges sessions prepared remarks to the conservative heritage foundation monday came in the context of a larger complaint about numerous court decisions that have blocked trump administration actions particularly its attempted crackdown on illegal immigration dreamers and its ban on transgender people serving in the military white house attorney united states department of justice executive washington supreme court jesse m furman environmental protection agency jesse m furman justice acting assistant attorney general steve bannon new york jeff sessions john gore commerce secretary wilbur ross sessions donald trump secretary of commerce wilbur ross president haiti el salvador united states courts of appeals executive branch justice department district of columbia supreme court of canada conservative heritage foundation u s court of appeals tara bahrampour civil rights division secretary

attorney general jeff sessions attacks judges thwarting trump agenda hits order for wilbur ross deposition as the supreme court considered whether commerce secretary wilbur ross [V: must] [ARG1: answer questions] in a court case about why he decided to add a citizenship question to the 2020 census attorney general jeff sessions on monday publicly attacked the judge who ordered ross to be deposed calling his actions outrageous even though they 've been upheld by three appellate judges sessions prepared remarks to the conservative heritage foundation monday came in the context of a larger complaint about numerous court decisions that have blocked trump administration actions particularly its attempted crackdown on illegal immigration dreamers and its ban on transgender people serving in the military white house attorney united states department of justice executive washington supreme court jesse m furman environmental protection agency jesse m furman justice acting assistant attorney general steve bannon new york jeff sessions john gore commerce secretary wilbur ross sessions donald trump secretary of commerce wilbur ross president haiti el salvador united states courts of appeals executive branch justice department district of columbia supreme court of canada conservative heritage foundation u s court of appeals tara bahrampour civil rights division secretary
